head.title: Shots Fired at TV Reporter in Mexico

hedline.hl1: Shots Fired at TV Reporter in Mexico

abstract.p: Shots are fired from high-caliber weapons at television reporter Lily Tellez in Mexico City in attack believed to be work of drug traffickers angered over her reports on narcotics trade; driver and bodyguards are hospitalized with bullet wounds; Tellez is unharmed S)

block.p: Three men in dark suits fired high-caliber weapons at a television reporter's car and at a second car with two bodyguards on Thursday night, the police said.
The reporter, Lily Tellez, was on her regular route from work at TV Azteca to her house.

The reporter, Lily Tellez, was on her regular route from work at TV Azteca to her house.
Ms. Tellez's driver and both bodyguards were hospitalized with bullet wounds. All three were listed in stable condition today.
Today, the federal and city police forces announced a joint investigation into the shooting.
The authorities cited suspicions that drug traffickers might have planned the crime.
The federal police provided bodyguards for Ms. Tellez last year after she had reported on the narcotics trade here.

More recently, Ms. Tellez had a dispute with District Attorney Samuel del Villar of Mexico City over his investigation into the slaying a comedian at TV Azteca, Francisco Stanley, last year. Mr. Stanley has also been linked to drugs.
